urls.title: Water firms are main source of microplastics in UK rivers, study says
urls.description: Research says discharge of untreated sewage and wastewater during dry spells to blame

tweets.text:
Important new research out today by @Jamie_Woodward_ & others identifies water firms as the main source of microplastics in UK rivers. 

Builds more pressure on government @EnvAgency to tackle the way water firms release untreated effluent into our rivers.
https://t.co/HKK1Ar0abP
@EnvAgencyMids Why are you giving them further actions while we continue to be gassed in our homes? They have not solved the problem, shut it down #stopthestink

More agricultural muck stored against the rules, literally on top of a watercourse this time. Directly under the muck pile runs a drainage ditch that runs straight into the River Frome, which runs straight into the Lugg, which exceeds phosphate limits. @EnvAgency /1 https://t.co/IhAXZqe2gs

@Jamie_Woodward_ @stushurlock @RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency It's still a good point. Water companies are expected to clean up after us, so we can continue doing whatever we want and not take any of the responsibility.

tweets.text:
Read our latest update to the situation at #WalleysQuarry #NewcastleUnderLyme here üëâ https://t.co/o558iAVicn 

A new gas flare we requested the operator to install was installed this week. It'll increase the amount of gas that can be collected & burnt off to help reduce odour. https://t.co/7KEj217PLA
@EnvAgencyMids were you onsite when this happened? What would have happened had you not been there? https://t.co/P8Bf6y2yWe

@ClareNicklin @DrMickSalt @StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids By law each loaded lorry has to have a consignment note with date, where the load came from and what the load consists of. The driver has to obtain a signature when loading and off loading the waste.
@EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgencyMids these gas flares when are they going to start using them? ü§î

In fact it's the third breach within 1 mile of where I live in the last few months.  This isn't isolated bad practice; it's a symptom of a wider problem.  Manure is valuable fertiliser but it's being dumped in places where it's a pollutant. /3
üëèüèª@AaronBell4NUL absolutely lamentable response over a long period from @EnvAgencyMids this goes right to the top of that organisation. @StinkStopthe https://t.co/kPOFXOlFbz

On #NationalStaffNetworksDay I want to celebrate and thank @EnvAgency networks for their tireless support and strength during the last year. 

Our culture of inclusion is nurtured by the diverse voices of our staff network volunteers. Consider joining if you have not already. https://t.co/M46k2505Q2

During an enforcement patrol we found two illegal crayfish traps at Chafford Gorges Nature Park‚òπÔ∏è

We are working with @EssexWildlife and members of the community to stop illegal #fishing in the area. 

If you witness illegal fishing please report it to 0800 807060 üìû #Essex https://t.co/HA2c41GU2e
Help by stopping sewage in our rivers we want to swim in not shrink PR from a water company @pow_rebecca @EnvAgency https://t.co/mMdFYSOGzn

tweets.text: @StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids If the EA were not there, what would have happened? Exactly what I knew was happening from the high H2S to CH4 ratio recorded on the MMF when I visited on 29th March: it would have gone into the heap.
@ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency Exactly this. What has really been dumped at site to cause these toxic gases? #StopTheStink https://t.co/Hag60cUkkz
@ClareNicklin @DrMickSalt @StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids That said, who‚Äôs to say the guy at the quarry tip is on the ball? Anything could be tipped tbh

No wonder we can‚Äôt breathe-what illegal hazardous waste is in that landfill? Send the endocrinologists in @PHE_EoEngland because I think we all know what‚Äôs happening here in the next 10 years @Cap_it_off #stopthestink @MattHancock @MPGeorgeEustice @BorisJohnson @EnvAgency https://t.co/qw4ovSATY7
